SENT.plain: A student pilot is referred for evaluation of a "head injury with post-traumatic amnesia." The case study presents a temporal association of injury and symptoms that were assumed to be related
A differential diagnosis of an amnestic syndrome is presented
Transient global amnesia is discussed as a possible etiology until an EEG revealed an epileptiform abnormality
The aeromedical implications, military and FAA, of the clinical and electrophysiologic findings are discussed
